course_description: Introduction to the concepts, assumptions, and methods underlying managerial accounting, with an emphasis on using accounting information to plan and control a company's operations. Topics include information relevant for decision-making, cost behavior, activity-based costing, pricing, cost-volume-profit analysis, operating budgets and variance analysis, capital budgeting, and performance evaluation. For MEMBA students.
prerequisites: This section is reserved for students in the Modular Executive MBA or the Hybrid Executive MBA program.
sections: Class Nbr: 1807, Section #: 2301, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: Does Not Meet, Instructor: U. Rackliffe, Status: Open
